titleStmt.title: An entry from the Journals of Hensley Henson

sourceDesc.bibl: Edited from the manuscripts in the custody of Durham Cathedral Library.

p.hi: Among my letters was another dolorous list of the Black–listed. It included the name of the man whom I had to report to the Bishop of Rochester in 1899, & whom I lost sight of until a few months ago when I was rather surprised to read a flatterous description of him in the "Yorkshire Post". Perhaps this may have led to the crash. How lamentable is this spectacle! I finished a sermon for the Cathedral next Sunday. M

Brian Dolphin came from Church Stretton to lunch, and spent the afternoon. The local paper contains two anonymous letters denouncing me for preaching in Nonconformist chapels! However on that question I have burned my ships, and shall take no heed of protests & letters signed as anonymous!
